Comment_glosser: contrary to what the comment by the contributor in Chan says, this numeral is correct and corresponds to '21' in other Mayan languages; u- is a third-person possessive prefix; this is a case of overcounting

The analysis is 4[⋅]20 as well bu this form does not correspond to what we know about Ch'orti' historical phonology. But it cannot be a loan from another Mayan language because the combination of PM *k > ch and PM *nh > j as suggested by chaj [t͡ʃax] only fits to a language from the Mamean branch and these are not known to be spoken in the vicinity of Ch'orti'.
